Dear Harry: s(Ji.
By this time you know that the radio research manuscript has
been cleared all the way for publication by Harwood. We're
really pleased at the cooperation and willingness to change
directions on this that everyone has shown. It’s good to
see this off the shelf.
Now to jump to something quite different. The National Head¬
quarters of the American Association of Agricultural College
Editors is now located here in Wells Hall. We're trying to
support this new venture in all ways possible - one of these
ways is to call members’ attention to various communication
items of potential use to them. One that we think they
should know about is the recording "A Word in Your Ear" from
the NAEB sponsored album Ways of Mankind. We'd like to make
several tape copies of this recording and offer them for loan
to members of AAACE, along with information on where they can
secure the recording for their own use.
In your opinion, would this be acceptable to NAEB? Would it
run counter to NAEB’s arrangement with Indiana University
Audio-Visual Center for distribution? Would Mr. Harley be
the one to write?
We’ll appreciate your advice.
Sincerely,
Donald E. Wells
Director
